titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
the Library of Virginia Accession 35467

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: A Guide to the Records of the Public Library Development Division of the Virginia State Library and Archives, 1920-1992

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Records of the Public Library Development Division of the Virginia State Library and Archives, 1920-1992. Accession 35467, State government records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Virginia.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Transferred 8/7/1997 by the Public Library Development Division.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: The Public Library Development Division began as the Extension Divison of the Virginia State Library in 1922 with the goal of establishing new libraries in counties that did not yet have library services and enlarging already existing library systems. The division also assisted local and regional authorities in the acquisition and operation of bookmobiles. In 1942 the Virginia General Assembly appropriated money for grants in aid to localities to establish libraries and in 1956 the Congress passed the Library Services Act, which provided funds to expand library services to rural areas. The Extension Division administered the distribution of both the state and federal funds.

The Virginia State Library reorganized in 1968 and the Extension Division was renamed the Library Development Branch and was given additional responsibility for cooperation, consultation and coordination within the public library network of the State. The Branch divided the State into four consultive areas and hired a consultant for each region.
The Virginia State Library was renamed the Virginia State Library and Archives in 1987 and the Public Library Development Branch became the Public Library Development Division.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into the following series:

list.item: Series I. Director's correspondence and subject files, 1920-1992;
Series II. Public Library Consultant files, 1968-1987;

did.unittitle: Series I. Director's correspondence and subject files, 1920-1992.

scopecontent.p: This series is housed in XX boxes and is arranged alphabetically. The Director's correspondence and subject files are divided into three sub-series: Public library files, 1920-1971; Public library files, 1971-1986; General correspondence and reports, 1941-1987; Subject files, 1928-1989; and JLARC study files, 1990-1992.

The public library files include mainly the incoming and outgoing correspondence and reports of the Division/Branch director to/from the various public libraries throughout the state, dealing with library establishment and development and funding issues. These files are arranged alphabetically by the name of the library or the locality (if no public library exists). General correspondence and reports includes the director's correspondence with various individuals and entities, and with public library consultants, and annual/quarterly reports of public library consultants. These files are arranged alphabetically or numerically by planning district. The subject files include information on various topics, including associations, conferences, services, and also include runs of several library publications. These files are arranged alphabetically by subject. The JLARC study files include files related to an investigation into the Lonesome Pine Regional Library and consist mainly of reports, statistics, clippings, manuals and notes. These files are arranged alphabetically by type of material.
This sub-series consists of X boxes and is arranged alphabetically by the name of the public library or by the locality if no public library exists, and in reverse chronological order thereunder.
